metadata.synopsis: Orin, Chosen of Bhaal lays dead by the Dark Urge. Bhaal has given his terms to the Dark Urge. Players has rejected Bhaal and died in the process.Players will reappear in camp.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin.3) Defy Bhaal's demands.

10.context: InternalNodeContext: Withers would have awoken the victim if Orin hadn't killed them at this point.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *For the first time in over a century, silence falls over the Bhaal Temple. No chants, no screams, no prayers.*
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DU is dead, corpse in the centre of the temple

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *In the end, your own death brought you more joy than any you wrought on this land. You are slipping into peaceful oblivion.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge opens their eyes, sharp intake of breath

2.speaker: Withers
2.text: Thou hast defied Bhaal, thy liege and father, and in doing so hast earned a place among champions and heroes.

3.speaker: Withers
3.text: But, alas, thy courage was in opposition to the divine cosmology that bound thee to the Lord of Murder.

47.speaker: Withers
47.text: Thou art now faithless - godless - and doomed to wander the Fugue Plane for eternity.

75.speaker: Withers
75.text: I will not permit that, though all the powers of life and death dictate that it should be so.

57.speaker: Withers
57.text: I, too, still hold some power, and I invest a portion of it in thee, who hath challenged the gods and now liveth to tell of it.

41.speaker: Withers
41.text: Thy fight is not over, and it is thy fight, for one who can look upon Bhaal and oppose him can survive any crisis.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers starts to magically heal the DU

73.speaker: Withers
73.text: So rise, Challenger of Gods, and prepare for battle once more. Death will not claim thee whilst I endure.

27.speaker: Withers
27.text: A scribe, a seneschal - a keeper of records. And now, thine advocate, both here, and in the City of the Dead.

80.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
80.text: I deserve to die - for all the evil I have done.

79.speaker: Withers
79.text: The sole way to atone for thine actions is to do better, in a new dawn. That dawn has come.

0.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
0.text: Thank you for giving me a second chance.

13.speaker: Withers
13.text: I can only give what thou hast earned.

1.speaker: Withers
1.text: Bhaal tried to extinguish thee, but his wrath is imprecise. He only succeeded in killing the part of thee he knew.

91.speaker: Withers
91.text: The Urge that drove thee to terrible acts. The spark of brutality that made thee his.

88.speaker: Withers
88.text: But there is a new part of you that hath grown during thy travels.

15.speaker: Withers
15.text: That part, Bhaal could not extinguish. And so instead of destroying thee, he hath made thee anew.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: He's right, you're no monster. You've saved me more times than I can count.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Was there ever any doubt? You are a champion. You overcome.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: Without you, I'd likely be long dead. Count me extremely grateful you're still here.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: You did it. You're free. I'm so godsdamn proud of you!

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: It must be said - because of you, I still breathe. Because of you, I still battle. I am not one to show gratitude, but - *ahem* - thank you.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: I'd be worm food if it wasn't for you. Thank you.

9.speaker: Withers
9.text: The heart of a saviour hath overshadowed the mind of a murderer.

6.speaker: Withers
6.text: It took time, but at the last, thine independence of heart overshadowed thy murderous mind.

11.speaker: Withers
11.text: I share thine enthusiasm. In mine own manner.

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: A genuine pleasure to meet you again, my friend.
76.context: NodeContext: Understated warmth - she's not overly sentimental, but is genuinely proud of us - we resisted our evil bloodline.

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: Minsc had his doubts about you, little Slayer, but Boo had none!

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: A triumph most deserved. Well done.

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: You're the author of your own tale now - well done.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: You get to start over. To be the person you want to be - not what someone else made you to be.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: You fought, and you prevailed. Your future will be what you make of it.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: Congratulations. That was hard-fought and well-deserved. You're free.
8.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Proud of a companion who faced down their demons

14.speaker: Withers
14.text: Greet the bloodless dawn, child of none.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU stands again, looks towards the vacant symbol of Bhaal in the temple

72.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
72.text: I have no idea what to do.

54.speaker: Withers
54.text: Thy path is clear. You must save Baldur's Gate.

61.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
61.text: Our enemies don't stand a chance.

28.speaker: Withers
28.text: Do not thank me - trust in thy courage, and the conviction of thy companions.

81.speaker: Withers
81.text: As it was, so it is again.

17.speaker: Withers
17.text: A hero has risen from a legacy of death.

66.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
66.text: Worry - so much of your brain is beyond repair.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *There is so little of you left.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *There is nothing left to do, but write yourself anew.*

34.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
34.text: Relish: with Bhaal gone, your sins will at last be truly yours.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Now, you may yet rule, and rule unhindered, rid of your domineering Father.*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *For now they believe you sweet and innocent, having triumphed against such evil.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *If you plan to command the world, no one will suspect a thing until it is too late.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *After all, you have not been turned good.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You can conduct atrocities whenever you please and get a peaceful night's sleep.*

23.speaker: Halsin
23.text: Well done - I knew your true nature remained, beneath those dark impulses. You are your true self, at last.

5.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
5.text: Did you know my nature all this time?

39.speaker: Withers
39.text: I know all, but to state truths is to interfere, for the minds of mortals are easily swayed. My place, for the most part, is to observe.

35.speaker: Withers
35.text: This intervention, the reclamation of thy soul, is beyond mine ordinary remit. But thou art extraordinary, and so are these times.

12.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
12.text: My old memories and my past self - I can never get them back?

26.speaker: Withers
26.text: If thou couldst recall in full every barbarity thou hadst committed, every tragedy thou hadst authored... wouldst thou truly want to?

46.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
46.text: Better not to know. Better to forget.

60.speaker: Withers
60.text: Nothing is ever truly forgotten - I will remember them always - but thou mayst turn thy mind to the future.

42.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
42.text: It is a dishonour to my victims to not recall their names.

22.speaker: Withers
22.text: All their names are written. One day, if thou truly wishest, I will show thee, and we shall remember them together.

53.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
53.text: I think it would drive me mad.

59.speaker: Withers
59.text: Indeed. And thou art recently cured of one form of madness - let us not exchange it for another.

21.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
21.text: I just want to rest - death seemed so peaceful.

74.speaker: Withers
74.text: There is no true rest for those like thee, faithless. But when victory is won, I swear I shall find thee a home.

18.context: InternalNodeContext: If Orin didn't kill them, Withers would have awoken them by this point.
